name: nuaavee Chef cookbook
readme:
nuaavee Cookbook ================ ![Cookbook Version](http://img.shields.io/cookbook/v/nuaavee.svg) Builds status: > master  [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/anshulverma/nuaavee-chef.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/anshulverma/nuaavee-chef.svg) > > release  [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/anshulverma/nuaavee-chef.svg?branch=release)](https://travis-ci.org/anshulverma/nuaavee-chef.svg) Description ----------- Set up a development environment just the way I prefer it to be. Modules keep the structure clean and the default recipie installs each one by iterating over the "modules" attribute. Requirements ------------ Currently only tested on Ubuntu 14.04 TLS #### packages - `timezone` - nuaavee needs timezone for ... TODO ... Attributes ---------- #### nuaavee::default
Key Type Description
['nuaavee']['basedir'] String Base directory of the cookbook
['nuaavee']['moddir'] String Path to the modules directory
['nuaavee']['modules'] Array Modules to be installed
Usage ----- #### nuaavee::default Just include `nuaavee` in your node's `run_list`: ```json { "name":"my_node", "run_list": [ "recipe[nuaavee]" ] } ``` Contributing ------------ 1. Fork the repository on Github 2. Create a named feature branch (like `add_component_x`) 3. Write your change 4. Write tests for your change (if applicable) 5. Run the tests, ensuring they all pass 6. Submit a Pull Request using Github Author ------------------- [Anshul Verma](http://anshulverma.github.io/) :: [anshulverma](https://github.com/anshulverma) :: [@anshulverma](http://twitter.com/anshulverma)
